DOC.brief_summary: Aims study : This single blind randomized-controlled trial test feasibility effect task orient train locomotor function , mobility balance multiple sclerosis subject moderate gait impairment ( EDSS 4 - 5,5 ) . The control group treat specific physical therapy ( usual care ) . Subjects method : 60 multiple sclerosis patient recruit outpatient rehabilitation clinic ( Azienda Ospedaliero-Universitaria di Ferrara ) . Informed consent obtain . Participants randomize ( TOCT ) task-oriented training ( experimental group ) usual care ( control group ) randomization stratification approach , accord block randomization 6 . The experimental group receive 10 task-oriented training session 2 week ( 5 sessions/week=intensive training ) . Three subject supervisor physiotherapist take part TOCT . Feasibility outcome measure specific questionnaire . Treatment efficacy outcome measure clinical test gait speed ( 10m walk test ) , walk endurance ( six minute walk test ) , balance ( Dynamic Gait Index ) mobility ( Time Up Go Test ) ; structure interview performance ( Lower Extremity Mal ) ; self-assessment questionnaire motor fatigue ( Fatigue Severity Scale FSS ) , multiple sclerosis physical psychological impact ( multiple sclerosis impact scale MSIS-29 ) , walk ability ( multiple sclerosis walk scale MSWS-12 ) . Outcome measure assess week treatment ( T0 ) , treatment ( T1 ) 3 month follow-up ( T2 ) evaluate treatment retention , clinician blind treatment .
